guidance: Great day to be active outside!

Good day to be active outside!

Community members who are unusually sensitive to air pollution could have symptoms.

Itâ€™s OK to be active outside, especially for short activities such as recess and physical education (PE).

For longer activities such as sports or outdoor physical activities, take more breaks and do less intense activities.

Watch for symptoms and take action as needed.

Individuals should follow their asthma action plans and keep their quick-relief medicine handy.

For all outdoor activities, take more breaks and do less intense activities.

Consider moving longer or more intense activities indoors or rescheduling them to another day or time.

Watch for symptoms and take action as needed.

Individuals should follow their asthma action plans and keep their quick-relief medicine handy.
Move all activities indoors or reschedule them to another day.
Move all activities indoors or reschedule them to another day.
